name: Roasted Turkey Breast with Stuffing
description: Herb roasted turkey breast and stuffing cook together for one easy and flavorful main dish in this Thanksgiving for two.
recipeIngredient: 2.5 lb. bone-in, skin on turkey breast ($12.21)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350ÂºF. Add the box of stuffing mix to a bowl, then pour in 1.5 cups warm water. Stir and let the stuffing sit to absorb the water as you prepare the turkey.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350ÂºF. Add the box of stuffing mix to a bowl, then pour in 1.5 cups warm water. Stir and let the stuffing sit to absorb the water as you prepare the turkey.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the room temperature butter, sage, rosemary, thyme, and salt in a small bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the room temperature butter, sage, rosemary, thyme, and salt in a small bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Pat the turkey breast dry, then spread the herb butter mixture all over the surface.
recipeInstructions.name: Pat the turkey breast dry, then spread the herb butter mixture all over the surface.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the stuffing to the bottom of an 8x8-inch casserole dish and place the turkey breast on top. The turkey should cover nearly all of the stuffing. If there is a lot of stuffing exposed, use foil to cover the stuffing mix to prevent it from browning too much during the hour and a half in the oven.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the stuffing to the bottom of an 8x8-inch casserole dish and place the turkey breast on top. The turkey should cover nearly all of the stuffing. If there is a lot of stuffing exposed, use foil to cover the stuffing mix to prevent it from browning too much during the hour and a half in the oven.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the turkey and stuffing to the oven (upper rack) and roast for about 1.5 hours, or until the internal temperature of the turkey breast reaches 165ÂºF.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the turkey and stuffing to the oven (upper rack) and roast for about 1.5 hours, or until the internal temperature of the turkey breast reaches 165ÂºF.

recipeInstructions.text: After roasting, let the turkey and stuffing rest for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving. The stuffing under the turkey will have absorbed quite a bit of moisture from the turkey, while the stuffing on the edges will be quite crunchy. Simply stir the stuffing together and let it sit for about five minutes to rehydrate the drier pieces before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: After roasting, let the turkey and stuffing rest for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving. The stuffing under the turkey will have absorbed quite a bit of moisture from the turkey, while the stuffing on the edges will be quite crunchy. Simply stir the stuffing together and let it sit for about five minutes to rehydrate the drier pieces before serving.

review.reviewBody:
This was absolutely perfect for my family. It was just me and my partner. It made just the right amount, with left overs too ðŸ™Œ 

My only thing with this recipe is that I couldnâ€™t find a bone in turkey breast small enough so I did bone out.

Thank you for this great guide. You couldn't have made it simpler to do a last minute traditional thanksgiving for two. I did it all in about 2 hours and there are plenty of leftovers after we stuffed ourselves.

I almost didn't make the green bean casserole, since I haven't loved it at past Thanksgiving meals, but it was the surprise standout here.
Everything turned out wonderful, and easy to make. Im a single mom with no family and this made more than enough for my son and myself!

I made this today and it was a smash. I think I went a little light on the salt, but everything was so tasty. Beautiful presentation. Great spread of flavor and textures. I did brine my turkey for just about 24 hours. I also added white wine, orange juice (it shouldve been lemon but i didnt have one on hand), groundmustard and garlic to the herb butter for the turkey. Portions were perfect with very minimal leftover. So Thankful for this recipe and walkthrough.
We just made everything and it all turned out. Pretty easy overall for two guys who donâ€™t love cooking! Thank you! Happy Thanksgiving!

I am trying this for this year's Thanksgiving for my husband and me.
I will adjust slightly.  We ordered a Smoked Turkey Breast from our local Boy Scout Troop.  So other than that, I'm doing the rest of the Dinner.  May add some dinner rolls and of course Pumpkin Pie (both store bought).

Best Iâ€™ve have had. 
Recipe presentation was awesome and so easy to follow. My son new to cooking was able to work with excellent results and worked through the steps easily 

Thank you for taking the time and effort to post.

Recipe presentation was awesome and so easy to follow. My son new to cooking was able to work with excellent results and worked through the steps easily 

Thank you for taking the time and effort to post.

I actually made turkey thighs and loved the results. 
I had fresh heirloom carrots from my garden. No Brussels sprouts. 
The gravy was delicious. 
My son and I really enjoyed our feast. 
X0
